message: A message bus is a nice way to decouple JavaScript.
Andrew Dupont on twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/andrewdupont and his blog: http://andrewdupont.net/
"We learned early on that people aren't wild about the HTML 5 GeoLocation permission dialog, so we just used the IP-based geolocation."
Events serve as a message bus in JavaScript. See .trigger() in jQuery: http://api.jquery.com/trigger/
Four MVCish JavaScript frameworks use the one that agrees with your brain: http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/ http://www.sproutcore.com/ http://cappuccino.org/ http://javascriptmvc.com/
Maintainability is not all-or-nothing. "It's like trying to keep a dirt-free house"
Improve old code little by little as you revisit it.
Gowalla uses sprockets for JavaScript dependency management in Rails: http://getsprockets.org/
Andrew doesn't find validation frameworks more useful than just writing case-by-case validations yourself. (I tend to agree)
@lancefisher Thanks for taking all these notes. Really helpful here1
